Shastrera Pramane. The Guru is actually non-different from Krishna. Guru is Krishna Roopa. Krishna Roopa Hane. Guru Krishna Roopa Hane. Shastrera Pramane.

And in the next line, Krishna Das Kaviraj Goswami is writing, Guru Roopa. Guru Roopa is one word now. Guru Roopa Krishna Krupakarena Bhaktagane. Krishna Krupakarena. Krishna will deliver Krupakarena Bhaktagane. He will deliver the devotees. Krishna will do that.

Guru Roopa. In the form of the spiritual master, Krishna delivers. It's Krishna who is delivering. But how does he deliver? Guru Roopa. So Guru Roopa is one word. Guru Roopa Krishna Krupakarena Bhaktagane.
So that is why Prabhupada translates this as, from the evidence of all the Vedic literatures,
the spiritual master, Krishna Krupakarena Bhaktagane.
So that is why Prabhupada translates this as, from the evidence of all the Vedic literatures,
the spiritual master is to be considered as good as Krishna himself.
Guru Krishna Roopa Hane. In the form of the spiritual master, Krishna delivers his devotees.
So this is the position of the spiritual master, who comes to deliver.
He is playing the same role.
He is playing the same role, same purpose that Krishna descended, Chaitanya Mahaprabhu descended, and the spiritual master descends for the same purpose, to reclaim the fallen souls.
And they are playing the, representing Krishna, who is Suhruddhama.
Prabhupada mentions, that if there is a, if there is a very close friend, with somebody we have a very close intimate relationship,
just like our father and mother, we all have intimate relationship, right, because we, they gave birth to us, they looked after us when we were small.
And we naturally recognize father and mother.
And if we don't recognize father and mother, they will say, what kind of a man you are?
You are supposed to have, you are supposed to recognize the role of father and mother, with whom we have an intimate relation.
But actually we understand that relationship is on a bodily level.
We understand that ultimately we are a spirit soul.
Now in the same way, or in a real way,
as spirit soul, we have an intimate relationship.
As a spirit soul, we have an intimate relationship.
We have an intimate relationship with Krishna.
He is the best well-wishing friend.
Now, the best use of intelligence is,
to realize, recognize and realize this intimate relationship we have with Krishna.
Because that realization is going to put an end to all our suffering.
And hence, when we don't recognize Krishna and come to the point of Krishna realization,
if we don't come, we have not used our intelligence wisely.
So, this is the message of the Gita and the Bhagavatam,
that our greatest well-wishing friend is Krishna,
and we must realize our relationship,
and come to the point of realizing that relationship.
And because these sages were rushing to see their Suhruddhama,
they became very angry like this.
Grantharaj Srimad Bhagavatam ki Shila Prabhupad ki Jai.
